p: Smallpox has not been observedin over 40Â years; however, concerns remain for use as a bioweapon. Major and minor criteria have been established to assist clinicians in recognition of smallpox [ 131]. Individuals under evaluation should be isolated, and standard, airborne, and contact precautions should be implemented. Local or state health authorities should be contacted to assist with confirmatory testing and public health interventions. PCR identification of variola DNA or isolation of the virus from a clinical specimen isrequired to confirm a diagnosis in specialized high-containment laboratories.
